description: Demonstrates setting up a complete TypeScript project with linting, testing, and CI configuration

visibility.bannerMessage: ðŸŽ¯ Running example prompt: Coding Project Setup - This demonstrates a multi-step coding workflow

plan.reasoning: This example demonstrates setting up a complete TypeScript project with modern tooling. We'll initialize the project, configure linting with ESLint, set up formatting with Prettier, add testing with Vitest, and create a GitHub Actions CI pipeline.

tasks.description: Initialize a new TypeScript project with package.json, tsconfig.json, and basic directory structure in /tmp/exprompt_playground. All file operations and terminal commands must use this directory as the working directory.

Configure ESLint with TypeScript support, including recommended rules and custom overrides for the project in /tmp/exprompt_playground. All file operations and terminal commands must use this directory as the working directory.

Set up Prettier configuration for consistent code formatting with TypeScript and integration with ESLint in /tmp/exprompt_playground. All file operations and terminal commands must use this directory as the working directory.

Install and configure Vitest for unit testing with TypeScript support, including a sample test file in /tmp/exprompt_playground. All file operations and terminal commands must use this directory as the working directory.

Create GitHub Actions CI workflow that runs linting, type checking, and tests on pull requests in /tmp/exprompt_playground. All file operations and terminal commands must use this directory as the working directory.
